org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.propositional

Class PL

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.Logic
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.propositional.PL
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PLAtomic, PLBinary, PLUnary

    public abstract class PL
extends Logic
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class defines propositional formulae. When propositions are viewed as Boolean variables, a propositional formula becomes a Boolean formula.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • pushNegation

        public abstract PL pushNegation()
        Pushes a negation into this formula as deep as possible. This method should be used for classical propositional logic.
        Returns:
        a formula obtained by pushing a negation into this formula as deep as possible

      • getNegationNormalForm

        public abstract PL getNegationNormalForm()
        Returns the negation normal form of this formula. This method should be used for classical propositional logic.
        Returns:
        the negation normal form of this formula

      • evaluate

        public abstract PL evaluate(java.util.Map<Proposition,java.lang.Boolean> m)
        Evaluates this formula.
        Parameters:
        m - an (partial) interpretation of propositions
        Returns:
        a formula obtained by changing every proposition p to m(p)

      • evaluate

        public PL evaluate(java.util.Set<Literal> literals)
        Evaluates this formula.
        Parameters:
        literals - a set of literals that hold
        Returns:
        a formula obtained by changing every proposition p to PL#TRUE if p ∈ literals or to PL#FALSE if ¬ p ∈ literals

        public static PL fromLiteral(java.lang.String lit)
        Returns a propositional formula that is exactly the specified literal.
        Parameters:
        lit - a literal, which may start with the negation symbol PLNegation.OP_STR
        Returns:
        a propositional formula that is exactly the specified literal

      • fromCNF

        public static PL fromCNF(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> cnf)
        Returns a propositional formula that is exactly the CNF formula formed by a specified list of lists of literals.
        Parameters:
        cnf - a list of lists of literals representing a propositional formula in CNF
        Returns:
        a propositional formula that is exactly the CNF formula formed by a specified list of lists of literals
